• Give oxygen by face mask.
• Aim for systolic BP ≥ 100 mmHg, or mean arterial BP ≥ 65 mmHg, respiratory rate < 30/minute, oxygen saturation
> 90 per cent, haematocrit > 30 per cent, and urine output of 30mls/hour.
• Consider adding adrenalin and emergency blood transfusion.
• Transfer to a specialist health facility with full documentation of treatment given, as soon as the patient is
reasonably stable.
